channel.title: unix on JJasonClark.com
channel.description: Recent content in unix on JJasonClark.com

item.title: Update DNSimple to point to your home router
item.author: jason@jjasonclark.com (Jason Clark)
item.description: The API at DNSimple allows easy updates. You can use them to add a subdomain to point to your home router. I make extensive use of this for remote pair programming.

item.title: Update your software
item.author: jason@jjasonclark.com (Jason Clark)
item.description: Don't forget to update your software every once in a while

item.title: Remote pairing with SSH and Tmux on a Mac
item.author: jason@jjasonclark.com (Jason Clark)
item.description: How to setup a Mac for remote pairing via Tmux. Including some scripts to help automate the process.

item.title: Installing Node.js on Ubuntu 10.04 server
item.author: jason@jjasonclark.com (Jason Clark)
item.description: Most of the guides I find on how to install [Node.js][1] on Ubuntu are not about installing the currently released version, instead they focus on installing the latest development release. I think this is the case because they assume the reader is familiar with doing software installs on unix from source. I'm coming from a Windows word were installing from the source is almost never done. This guide is for someone relatively new to unix installation or to Ubuntu server setup.

item.title: Install Cloudstack 3.0.0 on Ubuntu 10.04 Server
item.author: jason@jjasonclark.com (Jason Clark)
item.description: Cloudstack 3.0.0 was release on Febrary 28th 2012. At the time I was trying to install version 2.2 on a VM. I was having a lot of trouble so seeing a new version was wonderful. The following is what I had to do in order to get the system setup. Hopfully this post will help you get Cloudstack running in your environment.

item.title: Setting up NFS on Ubuntu 10.04 Server
item.author: jason@jjasonclark.com (Jason Clark)
item.description: I'm currently working on improving my knowledge of UNIX networking. One of the common tasks for a server is acting as an NFS server. These are the steps I take on an Ubuntu 10.04 server to setup NFS.
